intro: Bradleia glaucophylla, commonly known as the silver-leaf bradleia, is a rare and striking plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, silver-green foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. Bradleia glaucophylla thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
